messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Aoyama family crest
messages.msgSnippet: thanks, and if it wouldn t be too much of a trouble for you, i wouldn t mind getting those scanned mon. my book about the samurai by stephen turnbull doesn t
messages.messageBody:
thanks, and if it wouldn't be too much of a trouble for you, i wouldn't mind getting those scanned mon. my book about the samurai by stephen turnbull doesn't have the complete mon of the samurai families, that's why i was asking for it.
"shogun.uk" <shogun.uk@...> wrote:Hi Coeli,

There are many family crests (Mon) associated with the Aoyama. Of these I can readily identify five mon, the easiest to describe without a pic would be a circle with eight circles touching and surrounding it - a little like the Hosakawa. A further example would be a single coin (zeni); this is a circle with a small square cut out in the centre. To be a little more accurate you would need to identify the branch of the family or province in which they lived.

I could get some scan of these off to you if you need them.

Regards,

Rod Johnson

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Aoyama family crest
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Coeli, There are many family crests (Mon) associated with the Aoyama. Of these I can readily identify five mon, the easiest to describe without a pic would
messages.messageBody:
Hi Coeli,

There are many family crests (Mon) associated with the Aoyama. Of these I can readily identify five mon, the easiest to describe without a pic would be a circle with eight circles touching and surrounding it - a little like the Hosakawa. A further example would be a single coin (zeni); this is a circle with a small square cut out in the centre. To be a little more accurate you would need to identify the branch of the family or province in which they lived.

I could get some scan of these off to you if you need them.

Regards,

Rod Johnson

messages.subject: relationships?
messages.msgSnippet: I appolagise for asking what is probably a simple question with probably a well known answer but i am somewhat of a novice to the subject of samurai and just
messages.messageBody:
I appolagise for asking what is probably a simple question with probably a well known answer but i am somewhat of a novice to the subject of samurai and just joined this group recently to aid me in my quest for more knowledge about feudal japan and samurai themselves. To the point: Where samurai allowed to have relationships, marriages etc.? I would appretiate any answers (as long as they are correct) along with any advisable books websites etc. ThankyouJonathan Lee (scotland)
